A super amazing professor who is always excited to teach others.

One of the best professors I've had by far. Always dressed up in suits and was inspirational in class. keeps lectures interesting and can tell that he loves to teach. Super nice and amazing professor. Flexible with deadlines and makes time to help everyone.

Overall great professor and is extremely understanding when it comes to deadlines or missed quizzes. The class is a lot of work and graded tough but that is just ENGR 1181. Class material is fine and he mostly reads from the signs but still does his examples and occasionally gave rewards for partcipation

Dr. Parris is an interesting guy and has a lot of relevant industry experience. He was also very flexible with deadlines when our entire team got sick one week. Unfortunately, he teaches a really boring and unnecessarily work-heavy class. If youre stuck taking 1181, hes a good choice overall.

I strongly recommend avoiding any class taught by Lei Wang. He is extremely difficult to work with, both in terms of communication and accessibility. Despite having scheduled office hours, he is rarely present, making it nearly impossible to get assistance when needed. Emails go unanswered, leaving students frustrated and unsupported.
Lectures are hard to sit through, but mandatory. Doesn't upload slides in some classes. Randomly grades homework harshly.

Dr. Wang cares about student success and will work with students as needed, but his lectures are very dull and it is challenging to retain any of the information covered. Thankfully he uploads the slides online though, so it's easy to review from there. His labs also seemed arbitrary and pointless, but the class was not overly difficult.
Fav professor ever. Funny, helpful, and certainly a character you won't forget.

Dr. Hagenberger encourages students to think on their own and often pushes them toward projects with little to no guidance. His lectures also seem unnecessary, as he spends a good chunk of time telling personal stories, and the content he does cover could be easily sent in an email.
She's a good professor and very understanding. The class just sucks. Boring material.

Makes everyone comes to lectures even when people are sick and coughing around you because attendance is for a grade. When lecturing all she's doing is coping off another tablet and is way to focused not making mistakes that she forgets we are trying to learn. Terrible lecturer.

Dr. Mir is a good person and an OK prof. She cares and tries. I felt bad for her since the class doesn't pay attention; lectures are a snoozefest. HW was annoying to me, felt tedious and long. Exams were like the homework. Recitation has attendance. Would be better as inverted classroom. Again, she's nice, but lectures are monotone and boring.
Not the greatest lecturer but I think she understands that. Do the homework, exams are the same as study guides, she grades very leniently. She does explain very well if you go to her office hours.

I had heard prior to taking the course that she made exams fair and finals much more difficult, and this is exactly what happened. Exams 1 and 2 were similar to the practice exams, but the final was much more difficult than expected and brought my grade from an A- to a C+.

The midterms were pretty accurate to the homework. The final was slightly longer and harder than the midterms, but if you study enough and do enough practice you will be fine. She was a great lecturer, and she really cared that her students were learning! Going to TA office hours were super helpful for completing the homeworks. I def recommend her!

Professor Mir was awesome! Showing up to her lectures every day helps a lot with the class. While homework was time consuming, doing it really helps prepare you for midterms and finals. I learned a lot from her and I'd definitely take her class again.

Midterms were fair and on the easier side compared to the homework problems. The final was similar to the homework and reviews although I can see how some people think it was hard as it was harder than the midterms. Gives a surprising amount of extra credit in the homework, tests, and participation.
I had her for both mech2040 and aero3581, she is the goat with the latter, definitely redeemed herself after the former

Dr. Mir went pretty slow in lectures but this was helpful in truly understanding the material outside of class. She was very fair on homework and TA's provided examples of similar problems in recitation. The midterms and finals were all very fair. She offers a lot of small extra credit chances. She was also super helpful in office hours every time

I like Professor Mir but her teaching style is not for me, it is a little too slow-paced in lecture. I would've preferred to not go to any of the lectures but she had bonus quizzes in class but they ended up not counting for much. I did not like 2850 because many concepts felt useless, but I've heard it's a helpful class for the future.

Rather than keeping a consistent difficulty throughout, she makes the midterms really easy to build a false sense of security, then destroys the whole class on the final. Makes sense though, SEIs happen right before the final so the department will never hear anything but positives about her class. Solid teacher, unfair course structure.

Very boring and difficult to follow lectures with long and poorly explained homeworks.  My TA was nice but very little help. I struggled immensely in this class.  Plus side is pop quizzes are extra credit and the tests are very doable with excellent equation sheets.

Professor Mir was genuinely invested in our learning and explained the topics excellently, especially during the live lectures. She provides extra credit opportunities for assignments and was very lenient when grading the exams, so trust that you'll do great if you learn and apply the core concepts well.
dr mir is just bad. there's a ton of content and she doesn't help much even though she asks for feedback throughout the semester. her final exam is awful and brought my grade down 10%

The final took her from a 4/5 to a 2/5. The final was one of the worst I've ever taken, and was impossible to do in the provided time. The rest of the class was do-able if you worked hard. However, her lectures were long and boring, and her quiet voice and lack of 2x speed made them worse. Best advice, do as many practice problems as you can.

All she does in the zoom is go over the pre-recorded lectures word for word which is very unhelpful since the questions she answers do not clear things up. Learned much more from my TA than from her for 2040.

Lectures are not good and you can make it through the class without attending a single one with an A. However, the final is 100 times harder than any midterm or practice midterm she gives. The class average for the final was an F and it's worth 30% of the grade which is insane. Avoid this professor if you can because she screws you over at the end.

Lectures were overwhelming, my hand would hurt after. I liked this class UNTIL the end of the semester.  midterms were very fair and I did well. But EVERYONE got killed by the final and she didn't curve which ruined our grades. I also asked for an extension on HW and she said no because she didn't see the email I sent before she posted solutions...

Lectures are kind of boring but notes are published. Homework was usually very long taking 5+ hours a week and some problems you had to go to office hours or else you won't get the points. Midterms were fair but the final was not fun, I thought I failed but she gives a lot of partial credit. She curves if needed.
I liked having her as a professor and feel like the homeworks and midterms were very fair. However, her finals are very difficult and usually drop your grade a little bit.

Dr. Mir was a pretty solid professor, though mechanics of materials is a pretty boring class. The material is super important and start the hws at least 3 days in advance as it requires time to understand. She is very responsive to feedback (shortened hws & added extra credit questions to exams). The midterms were ok, but the final was brutal.
One of my best professors at OSU

Mir's lectures are a little dull, but she puts all the material online and it's not a necessity to attend class. She's available during her office hours though and will work with you one-on-one to make sure you understand the subject matter. As long as you review the notes and do the homeworks, you should be okay to pass.
Nice lecturer and shares his real-world experience, but kinda drones on at times and the midterm questions are random, seemingly-minor details from the slides.

Nice and will help if you ask. Class consist of difficult materials which, at times, could benefit from more thorough coverage. But she offers extra credit opportunities through labs and current events. Also allows for "cheat sheet" on quizzes and tests, which makes difficult material much more doable.
What a bro.  He will help you out if you have any trouble/questions.  This is his last semester, sadly.
Is a cool guy, doesn't know as much as some other TAs but is as helpful as he can be. Has a good sense of humor that lightens class up
He is very interested in helping his students, so nice, and very sexy, makes going to class so worth it. Best TA ever!!!!
Great TA, very helpful, down to earth guy once you get to know him, very friendly and worth going to class because he will help you alot
Great guy, loves to help you out when you have questions.  Easy person to talk to.  He is a down to earth guy who loves to help.  Great TA and funny guy
Dudes awesome,  'Nuff said.  also I'd tap that. (coming from a completely heterosexual male of course)

Everything is open note and he goes over every homework assignment before it's due. An awesome guy, and even though he makes it a fairly easy class, a lot is still learned and it's the perfect way to get a confidence boost starting in the major
Mr Mergel is awesome. You dont have to go to lecture but it helps a lot to go because he explains everything including homework and tests. Labs are great and he helps with everything.

Best professor in the department. The only thing to remember: Go to class. He explains everything including how to do the homework, step-by-step. Labs are hands on and is also clearly explained during lab sessions.
Intro to surveying was very easy.  He pretty much told us step by step what to do on everything and all tests were open notes.  Overall a great teacher.

An extremely easy class and you ACTUALLY feel like you're learning stuff. Has weekly assignments, 2 midterms & a final. Exams are open book. Mr. Mergel is very helpful and wants students to really understand basic surveying rather than simply taking exams. You learn a lot from the field work which is a ton of fun! Do the homework & practice exams!

Mergel makes this class EXTRA easy, Our first midterm had an average of 92, the second was 100 due to the extra credit opportunities on it.  Both were open note.  Don't expect to learn much from the Lectures, but the labs are a really great experience. Midterms are nearly identical to practice midterms he provides.
Exceedingly easy class. Has a very odd but entertaining sense of humor. Easiest A I've ever received.

One of the all time greatest professors at ohio state.  His class is *extremely* easy (97% avg on the first midterm), but I think I learned more in this class than any other class i've taken so far.  Hes got a dry sense of humour but is really hilarious.  Labs are kind of difficult sometimes but fun and you don't have to worry about your grade.

Don't get on his bad side! He was never willing to work with me after hours and in office hours. If he doesn't like you don't expect to get a decent grade because it will no happen. He does not care and in my opinion was hired to do research and not teach. Would not take him again if not nessacary but it is. Try to get on his good side early!!!

Exams are straight memorization with a couple homework-type problems at the end. Attendance not mandatory, but he'll take attendance on days that a lot of students skip and uses to bump your grade if you're in between grades. You also kind of need to attend to fill in blanks in notes but if you get those notes from another student, I'd say skip it.
Cool Guy

I thought I was going to get an A-, ended up with a C-. Class is so unbelievably boring (because he is an awful teacher), yet so simple. It's that easy class that you brush aside because the lecture is pointless and the homeworks are easy but since you ignore it you end up getting a bad grade.

Do not bother getting the text book for this class, it is not used. Do your best not to miss this class. It is extremely boring but you but all test questions come right from lecture notes. This class is all memorization. Exams were very similar to those given to classes in previous years.

He is probably unavoidable if you're a civil engineering major.  But it's not going to be a pleasant experience. No curve, exams are straight memorization, need to memorize exact answers.  only 2 homeworks, each worth 6% of your grade for course.  Labs are a good time though, you get to make concrete!

I was very disappointed. His syllabus is useless as he announces exams a week before and only gives out hw in class. His lectures are awful as he will waste your time and half the class on random digressions. He is a seemingly nice man, but he is simply a bad professor and the otherwise great CE department would benefit from his retirement.
Had him for 431, and 451. Pretty useless as a professor, he acts very unprofessional and doesn't really have any strategy for teaching the material. He turned an easy class hard.
One of my favorite profs in CE.  Just a loveable guy, and very nice.  He has a unique teaching style, but gets the material across.  I recommend this guy highly.

Had him for ce431, 451, and 535. Great professor, learned much from him. Go to class as he makes things much clearer than the book. He sometimes sings the notes as he writes on the board, and occasionly has some funny jokes. One of the best in CE

Has a very good lecture style where he provides many notes to you, so you can listen to what he says.  Labs were fun and educational.  Had 2 homeworks both were fairly easy.  His tests are difficult make sure to know definitions, homework solutions

Very very good professor. Really helpful, home works covered 30% and we had only 4 which were very very easy. His mid terms are very  tough, make sure you understand the concepts, the final was very easy and expect A- to B in his class. ME/CE 662 is a grad level course, comes under tech. electives in design and manufacturing for ME students

This was the first semester Gaj taught this class - so the material was new to him - but he still did an amazing job getting across really complex ideas in a way we could understand. Very approachable and willing to spend time outside of class if you need it. Take this class if you can

LUC Students -- you only have one more semester to take Gaj for UCSF137 and you will not regret it. A teaching style like I have never experienced before -- engaging, energetic, and he does not bore you with details. Lots of easy homework assignments/reading quizzes to pad your grade. 3 quizzes and a final (study sheets are allowed)

Loyola students, take Professor Sivandran for UCSF 137. Great professor with clear expectations.  Lectures are not always exciting, but material is straightforward. If you go to class, you will get an A.
Loved the storied - made it worth coming to class. Tough grader - but always willing to work with you outside of class
Gaj is tough. But by the end of the class i realized i learned alot. He knows alot about this this stuff, and he loves to tell stories (it keeps things interesting).

Gaj is a vey intelligent person and is obvious from the outset.  His lectures are interesting and engaging.  Sometimes the math is difficult to follow. His tests are tough.  Don't expect to see math problems directly from the homework.  They will be similar but a harder variation. Gaj cares. If you are struggling, go see him.  He wants to help you.
My favorite CE professor (EnvEng Major here). Always helpful, knowledgeable, and never overloaded us
He is just awesome. Always relevant topics discussed, really interesting, isn't going to give you BS stuff to do. Always willing to help.
Gaj really wants his students to learn how to think about a problem rather than robotically repeat what you have done in homeworks. He has changed the way i think about engineering

Gaj is great as a professor--helpful, unbelievably laid back, great lecturer, and obviously loves what he teaches. He's not the kind of prof to leave the classroom and just ignore your emails, either: to anyone looking for a mentor or just some solid advice about their engineering career, I highly recommend you find a way to connect with this guy.

He is a great teacher. He lays everything out very clearly. His homeworks are tedious but are usually graded for completion and effort. Exams are more conceptual and less math based. You get to make a cheat sheet for both tests. Make sure to go to him for regrades, he gives back lots of points.
Awesome professor, class was tough but I learned alot.
He is very helpful and engaged in your success in his class. He is very interactive which makes class time interesting.

If you're looking for practical applications of GPS in the civil engineeringsurveying field, you won't learn any of that with her. She only covers a lot of the theory and it's more tailored to graduate students who are more keen on research and theory than practical applications.  There are quizzes, midterm, finals and a final project.

She was excellent.  She was ill for about half the quarter but she was fantastic the half she taught.  Accent is easy to understand, tests are straightforward, not difficult to earn an A or A-.  Project is 10% of grade, very open-ended.  Her office hours were helpful as well.

This was an intro statistics course for CE majors. Entire course was based on two midterms, a research paper, and a final. Very helpful professor. Very willing to help students in answering questions and improve. She's a great professor to seek help from during office hours. Exams were pretty straightforward.
The best Civil teacher I have had. The class was not the easiest but you get what you put into it. John graded very fair and was always willing to help.
I learned a lot from this instructor. Like any class, it definitely helps to go talk to him.

Great instructor. Teaches relevant material. Willing to help students who ask for help. Easy to understand. Tests are long but not difficult. Take this class if you want to actually learn relevant material from a great instructor.

2 hour class, gave no break.  Nothing from class is used on homework. Exams so long not a single person finishes them. Tries too hard to be funny. Writes things on the board and erases before you can copy. "Lectures" by flipping thru a powerpoint. Very few examples in class. You definitely need to teach yourself from the book. Avoid if you can
Worst class ever! No one can understand what he is saying, and he gets worked up about everything.  Also, he gets mad when you show too much work.

Prof. K.V. Balasubramanyam teaches CE4310 (Structural Analysis). Genial & approachable guy. Teaching method consists of writing on chalkboard, mostly notes found in the textbook. Could make class better by use of visual aids and more interactive. Class lecture feels like a long one-way sermon.

Dean knows his stuff. He makes the class interesting by having field trips and mini-tasks where you have to search for information or go to certain locations. He loves surveying law and history and would give you a lot of insight into that as well as things about engineering. Very unique course. He covers things that a civil engineer ought to know!
Amir was by far the best TA I had ever had in my life. He is very picky in grading but he is the best. Always smiling, always helpful, and always caring for his students.
Cool guy as well as very caring. Highly recommended.
Amir is awesome! He will improve your quality of life.

I love his lectures. 7:30am never missed a day, he is never late and always seated before anyone arrives. Exams are fair, notes are very useful and final presentation is as fair as the outside world....Just study and you would be dancing with a smooth A.
